results.content: It started really good but got confusing around section 11. It would also have been nice to have the source code to check as time went by. It lacked detail and professionalism, really amateurish feeling to the course. Audio is not that great and English at times is unrecognisable.
results.content_html: It started really good but got confusing around section 11. It would also have been nice to have the source code to check as time went by. It lacked detail and professionalism, really amateurish feeling to the course. Audio is not that great and English at times is unrecognisable.

results.content: For anyone with a basic understanding of PHP, this is a top-notch course for advancing your knowledge of the language and for gaining practical skills that will help you build real-world applications.  After completing this course, I have a firmer understanding of object-oriented programming and, most importantly, how to use OOP for building better, more organized, and more maintainable programs.  Throughout this course, the instructor provides step-by-step instructions that are straight forward and easy to follow.  Emphasis is on application rather than theory, and the course project is a real jewel.  This combination provides a practical level of learning that some of the other online programming courses fail to bring forth.  The result is that by course end you will have more than just a theoretical understanding of the PHP language construct, you know how to apply PHP to build something useful and marketable.   This course if not for beginners, but if you have a basic understanding of PHP and at least a little familiarity with OOP and MySQL, this course provides a treasure-chest of information which can help you advance your programming abilities and set you on a path to a rewarding career as a web developer.  Take this course, stick with it, finish it, and subsequently build your own projects based on what you have learned, and you will be on the road to PHP mastery.

response.content: Thanks so much for the wonderful review Robert :)
response.content_html: Thanks so much for the wonderful review Robert :)

results.content: Nice Course the blog works but 1) We don't have a category folder and the url is like ?tag= (no good for SEO) if I put a tag the slug has to been like: /tag-name/post-name/ 2) If I enter a post title the title is the slug, but an uppercase slug. Example, a title like: Very nice pictures. The slug appear like this: Very-nice-pictures and has to appear like: very-nice-pictures. If you update this two things the course deserves 5 stars.

Example, a title like: Very nice pictures. The slug appear like this: Very-nice-pictures and has to appear like: very-nice-pictures. If you update this two things the course deserves 5 stars.
